column2: Quercus petraea,Q. petraea has a more elliptic leaf shape with an acute leaf base. The leaf underside is (more) hairy. The petioles are longer and generally groved and the acorns are bigger and sessile., Quercus robur x petraea, Such hybrids tends to have non sessile acorns (of Q. robur) and long petioles and hairy leaves (of Q. petraea)
A strong and long lived tree with distinct lobed leaves and acorn fruit (borne in involucre 'cups'. Flowers before leaves.
